2025-11.daily_overview: Sunday is family day, as well as the time for Ma Xiulan and her husband’s scheduled "breakfast date." After enjoying their rare time together as a couple, she returns home, where she supervises the children in completing their weekend homework while continuing to learn how to make electronic photo albums and organizing scattered household information. The day unfolds at a leisurely pace, filled with warm family interactions.

events.name: Sunday Breakfast Date with My Husband
events.description: Early in the morning, Ma Xiulan had asked her mother, Li Xiuying, to come over a day earlier to look after the children. The couple got up early and walked to a time-honored breakfast stall near their home, which they had frequented for over a decade. They ordered their favorite Tianjin steamed buns and two bowls of noodles with gravy, sitting at simple outdoor tables and chairs. While enjoying the warm breakfast, they chatted about their children’s amusing antics, their father’s recovery, and the trivial matters the husband had encountered while driving for hire recently. Without the noise of the children or the pressure of household chores, this brief moment of solitude brought them a long-missed sense of relaxation and closeness, quietly deepening their bond through simple conversation.

events.name: Continue learning electronic photo album production
events.description: In the morning, my niece arrived as scheduled to continue yesterday's lesson. Today's instruction covered how to add simple transition effects, select appropriate background music, and finally generate and save the file. Ma Xiulan chose photos from last year's trip to Beijing and the mid-year family gathering. Under her niece's guidance, she adjusted the order of the photos one by one and paired them with melodious folk music. When the first rough but complete electronic photo album was generated, she watched the flowing family memories on the screen, and a smile of surprise and satisfaction appeared on her face.

events.name: Organizing Family Affairs and Information
events.description: In the afternoon, while the children were doing their homework, Ma Xiulan carefully transcribed the scattered school information she had recently collected about her eldest child's further education, suggestions from relatives and friends, and key points from her discussion with her husband the previous night into a dedicated notebook. She also updated her helpful neighbor Zheng Xiuying via WeChat on the progress of the homestay communication and thanked her once again for the introduction. After completing these tasks, she felt the tangled mess in her mind had been sorted out, and she became clearer about what to do next.

events.name: Prepare ingredients for a week
events.description: In the evening, Ma Xiulan went alone to the vegetable market near her home and purchased a sufficient amount of long-lasting vegetables such as Chinese cabbage, potatoes, and radishes from the familiar vendor, Auntie Sun, along with eggs and pork needed for the week. Being meticulous with her budget, she always managed to buy some slightly imperfect but affordable [closing-time vegetables] at this hour, saving a portion of the frugal household expenses.

events.name: Late sleep due to unexpected visit from a friend.
events.description: In the evening, my childhood friend Liu Chunmei paid an unexpected visit, bringing homemade pastries. The two reminisced about childhood anecdotes and caught up on recent family news, and before they knew it, it was past ten o'clock. Although Ma Xiulan was delighted, she realized she had to get up early the next day. She hastily ended the conversation and ended up going to bed half an hour later than originally planned.

起始状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
起始状态.心情: Relaxed and expectant, as a breakfast date with my husband has been arranged.

结束状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
结束状态.心情: Warmly content yet slightly weary, the happiness brought by family relationships fills the heart.

state.今日运动: It takes about 30 minutes to walk to the breakfast stall and the food market.

date_attribute.weather: Cloudy, with light rain in the evening

2025-11.daily_overview: At the start of the new week, life returned to its usual rhythm. While managing household chores, Ma Xiulan received an important order opportunity from the community, which filled her with both excitement and pressure. At the same time, small incidents like a broken lightbulb at home reminded her that life is composed of countless trivial yet essential tasks.

events.name: Repairing Home Lighting
events.description: While cooking dinner, the energy-saving light bulb in the kitchen suddenly went out. Ma Xiulan did not immediately call her husband. Instead, after finishing the meal and cleaning up, she walked to the small supermarket run by Zhang Shufen diagonally across the street. Zhang Shufen warmly helped her select a bulb of the same model and chatted briefly about recent vegetable prices and their children’s studies. After returning home, Ma Xiulan carefully stepped onto a stool to replace the bulb. As warm light filled the room again, she patted her hands together in satisfaction.

events.name: Received the New Year order invitation from the community.
events.description: In the afternoon, community grid worker Zheng Xiuying contacted Ma Xiulan via WeChat, excitedly informing her that the community was preparing for the New Year activities and needed to customize a batch of hand-embroidered pendants as souvenirs and decorations. She asked if Ma Xiulan was interested in taking on the project. Zheng Xiuying roughly outlined the requirements: approximately 30 pieces, with a festive theme that reflected the community’s characteristics, and provided a preliminary budget range. Upon hearing the news, Ma Xiulan’s heart raced—this was far more formal than the scattered jobs she had taken on before. Suppressing her excitement, she cautiously expressed great interest and hoped to learn more specific details.

events.name: Independently completed the first electronic photo album
events.description: During her lunch break, Ma Xiulan recalled the steps her niece had taught her and attempted, without relying on guidance, to use a mobile app to create a short electronic photo album from some family photos taken over the weekend. Although the process was bumpy and required several attempts, she felt a small sense of pride in mastering a new skill when she finally succeeded. She decided to surprise everyone with it during the weekend family gathering.

events.name: Supervise children's homework and prepare tomorrow's breakfast.
events.description: After dinner, she routinely checked the completion of her three children's homework, focusing on helping her second son, Ma Mingzhe, with a math word problem. Once the children were asleep, she moved the steamed buns for the next morning from the freezer to the refrigerator to thaw and rinsed the millet in preparation for the morning porridge. These seemingly repetitive tasks serve as the foundation for maintaining the smooth functioning of her household.

events.name: Insomnia due to excitement over an order
events.description: Lying in bed, Ma Xiulan repeatedly pondered over the details of the order, worrying whether she could complete it on time and with high quality. The mixture of excitement and anxiety caused her to toss and turn, making her stay up nearly an hour later than usual.

起始状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
起始状态.心情: Steady, ready to embrace the household chores and caregiving tasks of the new week.

结束状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin

2025-11.daily_overview: Today was a busy and fulfilling day. Ma Xiulan visited the community in the morning to thoroughly discuss order details and conduct preliminary negotiations. In the afternoon, she efficiently handled family health matters (scheduling vaccinations) and a new invitation for community volunteer work. In the evening, she convened a family meeting to coordinate the new schedule, demonstrating excellent family management skills.

events.name: Conduct interviews and confirm community embroidery orders
events.description: In the morning, Ma Xiulan arrived at the community service center in light rain to communicate face-to-face with Zheng Xiuying. Zheng Xiuying presented the design draft—a pattern integrating the community logo with elements of the Chinese character [福], lanterns—and clarified the requirements for the pendant’s dimensions, fabric, color scheme, and delivery standards. Ma Xiulan listened carefully, silently calculating the labor hours and material costs in her mind. Drawing on her years of experience, she quoted a total price of 500 yuan, which included both material and labor costs. After discussing with the community director, Zheng Xiuying gladly agreed. Although no formal contract was signed, both parties verbally confirmed the transaction, and Ma Xiulan felt the weight of responsibility on her shoulders.

events.name: Materials Required for Purchase Orders
events.description: After leaving the community service center, Ma Xiulan did not go home. Instead, she rode her electric scooter directly to the fabric market in Jinghai District. Following the requirements, she carefully selected materials such as red cotton fabric, golden embroidery thread, and stuffing cotton. To control costs, she visited several shops to compare prices and eventually purchased the first batch of materials at an affordable price, mentally calculating the potential profit from this batch of work.

events.name: Inquire and schedule family influenza vaccination
events.description: In the afternoon, Ma Xiulan saw the influenza vaccination notice in the community WeChat group. Thinking of her father, who had just recovered from a serious illness and had weakened immunity, as well as her three school-going children who were prone to cross-infection, she immediately took it seriously. She called the Jingwen Road Community Health Service Center to inquire in detail about the vaccination schedule, eligible groups, and costs, and specifically asked whether her father, who had a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), was suitable for vaccination. After receiving an affirmative response from the doctor, she decisively scheduled appointments to take her youngest daughter for vaccination on Friday afternoon this week and her father next Monday.

events.name: Received an invitation to volunteer at the community senior dining hall.
events.description: In the evening, Zheng Xiuying came to visit again, this time bringing another piece of news: the newly opened community canteen for the elderly needed to recruit regular volunteers to help with washing vegetables, food preparation, and meal distribution every Tuesday and Thursday morning. Volunteers would be provided with a free lunch and a small labor subsidy. Zheng Xiuying thought Ma Xiulan was diligent and warm-hearted, so she immediately thought of her. Ma Xiulan listened carefully, quickly calculating her weekly schedule in her mind: Wednesday handicraft activities, daily care for her father, household chores, the children... She did not agree immediately but sincerely expressed that she needed to go home and discuss it with her family before giving a reply.

events.name: Hold a family meeting to coordinate the new arrangements.
events.description: After dinner, Ma Xiulan gathered her husband and three children in the living room and explained in detail the two matters: the community order and the invitation to volunteer at the senior dining hall. She clarified that if she accepted the volunteer work, she would need to be out on Tuesday and Thursday mornings each week, and she hoped her family could cooperate by sharing the household responsibilities. Her husband, Ma Zhiqiang, expressed his support and promised to return home early on those two evenings to check the children’s homework. The eldest son, Ma Mingxuan, also sensibly offered to help look after his younger siblings. The support from her family warmed Ma Xiulan’s heart and gave her more confidence to take on this new challenge.

起始状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
起始状态.心情: Feeling motivated, both nervous and excited about the upcoming order interview.

结束状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
结束状态.心情: Fatigue coexists with satisfaction after busyness, and one feels that family is their most solid support.

2025-11.daily_overview: A sudden drop in temperature heralds the arrival of late autumn. Ma Xiulan's day revolves around [winter preparations]: from inspecting and cleaning to lighting the coal stove at home, a series of skilled operations quickly shift the household into winter mode. At the same time, she is continuously learning and adjusting—from researching e-commerce discounts to optimizing her morning routine, and even politely declining additional work that conflicts with her core responsibilities. Each step reflects her traditional and pragmatic wisdom in managing the household.

events.name: Winter Heating Preparation: Inspection and Cleaning of Coal Stoves
events.description: Feeling a distinct chill, Ma Xiulan knew it was time to light the coal stoves. In the morning, she carefully inspected the stove bodies, chimney connections, and ventilation openings of the two coal stoves in the living room and bedroom. Using an old cloth, she wiped away the surface dust and checked for any damage or blockages. After confirming their safety, she put on gloves and a mask, then thoroughly cleaned out the accumulated old coal ash and slag from the stoves—which had built up over nearly a year—using fire tongs and an ash bucket. She also swept the floor around the stoves clean.

events.name: Procurement of Winter Coal
events.description: After completing the cleanup, Ma Xiulan rode her electric bike to the coal station she frequents near her home. Based on past experience, she purchased enough honeycomb briquettes to last until the Spring Festival. The coal station staff helped her load the coal onto her vehicle and transport it home. Ma Xiulan then personally arranged the heavy honeycomb briquettes neatly in the coal shed, piece by piece, working until fine beads of sweat appeared on her forehead.

events.name: Light the coal stove and remind family members about safety.
events.description: As dusk fell and the sky darkened, the room grew increasingly cold. Ma Xiulan first used waste paper and firewood to kindle the fire, then carefully placed the honeycomb briquettes into the stove. Watching the orange-red flames gradually rise and drive away the chill in the room, she felt a comforting warmth. During the family dinner, she sternly warned her three children, especially the lively and active second son, Ma Mingzhe, that they must never approach or touch the scalding stove walls. She repeatedly emphasized that a window must be left slightly open at night for ventilation to prevent carbon monoxide poisoning.

events.name: Research on [Double Eleven] Shopping Discounts
events.description: In her free time in the evening, Ma Xiulan took out her phone and began studying the complex promotional rules of major e-commerce platforms for [Double 11]. Discounts for reaching a certain amount, coupons, advance deposits... these new terms left her somewhat dazzled. She mainly focused on the prices of household essentials such as grain, oil, and toilet paper. She also shared the [amazing coupons] and bargains she discovered with her neighbor Wang Guilan via WeChat, discussing which ones truly saved money and which were just marketing tricks.

events.name: Optimize the Morning Household Chores Process
events.description: To prepare for the potential increase in volunteer work, Ma Xiulan tried to adjust her morning routine. She woke up twenty minutes earlier than usual, cooking porridge in the rice cooker while quickly tidying the living room and cleaning the kitchen. By the time the children got up and washed up, she had already set breakfast on the table. Although time remained tight, she found that planning ahead and multitasking significantly improved efficiency, and she decided to continue trying and refining this approach the next day.

events.name: Declining the Invitation to Become a Regular Community Volunteer
events.description: After a night of deep thought and further discussion with her husband, Ma Xiulan clearly realized that simultaneously fulfilling community orders, providing high-quality care for her father, and managing a household with three children was nearing the limit of her capacity. In the morning, she proactively contacted Zheng Xiuying via WeChat voice message and very sincerely explained the situation: "Sister Zheng, thank you for thinking of me. The senior cafeteria is a wonderful initiative, but after calculating my time, I'm truly worried about spreading myself too thin—neglecting orders and failing to properly care for the elderly at home. How about this: I won't take up a fixed position, but for any temporary help needed at the cafeteria in the future, such as weekend dumpling-making events, please feel free to call me anytime. I'll definitely come to help!" Upon hearing this, Zheng Xiuying was very understanding and even praised her for managing her life so well.

events.name: Morning exercise was postponed due to cold weather.
events.description: The morning was cold, and Ma Xiulan felt discomfort in her shoulders and neck. She decided to cancel her morning walk temporarily and only performed simple neck stretches indoors. This reminded her of the need to adapt her exercise routine for the winter.

起始状态.所处地点: In the bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
起始状态.心情: Feeling somewhat pressed due to the cooling weather and numerous pending tasks.

结束状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
结束状态.心情: Steady and resolute, preparations for winter have been completed with clear decisions made on priorities.

2025-11.daily_overview: After clarifying the priorities of various matters, Ma Xiulan focused on core tasks today. She officially signed the community order agreement and produced samples, marking a crucial step in transforming her craft hobby into a contractual [micro-enterprise]. Meanwhile, she was also busy ensuring her family's health security (confirming vaccinations) and optimizing the care process for her father.

events.name: Formally Sign the Community Embroidery Order Agreement
events.description: In the morning, Ma Xiulan returned to the community service center. Zheng Xiuying presented a simple yet clearly outlined order agreement, which specified the production of 30 embroidered ornaments, including their dimensions, pattern requirements, delivery date (before December 5th), and a total payment of 500 yuan. Ma Xiulan read through the agreement word by word and, after confirming its accuracy, solemnly signed her name [Ma Xiulan] in the space designated for Party B. As she received her copy of the agreement, she felt her palms grow slightly damp. This was not like the casual jobs she used to take on with immediate cash payments; it was a weighty responsibility and commitment.

events.name: Produce order samples and confirm details
events.description: After returning home in the afternoon, Ma Xiulan eagerly began her work. Following the design draft, she meticulously crafted the first sample of an embroidered pendant. From tracing the pattern and selecting the colors of the embroidery threads to stitching with swift and precise needlework, she remained fully focused. Once the sample was completed, she examined it carefully, checking whether the stitches were even and tight and whether the color combinations were festive and tasteful. She then took a photo and sent it via WeChat to Zheng Xiuying for confirmation. Zheng Xiuying quickly replied: "Xiulan, this is excellent! Let's proceed according to this standard!" With this affirmation, Ma Xiulan's confidence grew significantly.

events.name: Confirm the specific details of vaccination.
events.description: During her lunch break, Ma Xiulan called Dr. Wang from the community health service center to reconfirm the specific procedures for bringing her younger daughter to receive the influenza vaccine the following afternoon, the required documents (household registration booklet, vaccination certificate), and the special precautions to be taken when her father receives his vaccination. Dr. Wang patiently answered each question, putting her mind at ease.

events.name: Adjust Father's Care Time to Accommodate Potential Busy Periods
events.description: Considering the need to focus on completing orders over the next month, Ma Xiulan deliberately streamlined the daily care routine more efficiently when visiting her mother’s home. She discussed with her mother that from now on, her visits would primarily involve checking her father’s health condition, preparing ingredients for lunch and medications, while the actual cooking and extended companionship would be mainly handled by her mother. Ma Xiulan would then visit again in the afternoon or evening when she had free time. Her mother, Li Xiuying, fully supported her daughter and encouraged her to focus on her own tasks without worry.

events.name: Forgot to take a lunch break due to intense focus on work.
events.description: While engrossed in making the sample, Ma Xiulan missed her usual lunch break, which left her feeling slightly fatigued in the afternoon. However, she refreshed herself with hot tea and continued working.

起始状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
起始状态.心情: With a clear objective and a hint of nervousness before signing the agreement

结束状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
结束状态.心情: Full of drive and a sense of responsibility, the official implementation of the craft orders brings new challenges and motivation.

2025-11.daily_overview: Friday marked the conclusion of the week. Ma Xiulan initiated batch production for community orders, taking the first step toward systematic manufacturing. Meanwhile, household financial management entered a critical [execution day], as she and her husband completed their first monthly mandatory savings, injecting the first tangible reserve into the family's long-term goals. The evening tutoring session for their eldest son served as a microcosm of the day-to-day responsibilities of family life.

events.name: Begin mass production of embroidery pendants.
events.description: After sending the children to school, Ma Xiulan tidied up a corner of the living room as a temporary workspace. She spread out the red cloth, took out the samples and templates she had made the day before, and began mass production. She planned to complete at least two to three pieces each day to ensure ample time. Threading the needle, the familiar *chichi* sound filled the air as she quickly immersed herself in the work. By the end of the first morning, she had completed the outline embroidery for two pendants.

events.name: Implement monthly forced savings with husband
events.description: In the evening, Ma Zhiqiang handed over part of his newly received salary to Ma Xiulan. The two sat at the dining table, where Ma Xiulan took out the account book to review the known fixed expenses for the month: utilities, gas bills, their child's meal expenses, and extracurricular class fees. After deducting these costs, they decided to set aside 800 yuan from the salary as an [education reserve fund] for their eldest son, Ma Mingxuan, to be deposited into a dedicated account. Ma Xiulan carefully placed the money in an envelope, planning to go to the bank the next day to handle the deposit. This marked the first implementation of the savings plan they had formulated the previous month. Though the amount was modest, it held significant meaning.

events.name: Tutoring the eldest child in his studies and monitoring his progress.
events.description: After dinner, Ma Xiulan checked her eldest son Ma Mingxuan's homework. She noticed that his recent math assignments had a somewhat high error rate, and he always seemed distracted. Instead of criticizing him immediately, she sat down and went through each problem with him, patiently explaining the reasoning. During the process, she gently probed to see if he was under pressure from his studies or if something was happening at school. Ma Mingxuan only vaguely said, "It's a bit difficult," and was unwilling to elaborate. Ma Xiulan took note of the situation in her mind, planning to observe further.

events.name: Organize out-of-season clothing
events.description: Taking advantage of the clear and dry weather, Ma Xiulan washed and dried the family’s light jackets, shirts, and other summer and autumn clothing, then sorted, folded, and placed them into storage boxes, which she tucked under the bed. At the same time, she took out the heavy down jackets and cotton pants, hanging them in a well-ventilated area to air out, preparing for the impending severe cold. This seasonal [major task] took her the entire afternoon.

events.name: Relaxing dietary restrictions due to successful savings.
events.description: To celebrate the first execution of savings, Ma Xiulan prepared an extra dish of sweet and sour pork tenderloin for dinner. The whole family enjoyed the meal, and she herself ate more than usual, resulting in a slight increase in her weight.

起始状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
起始状态.心情: Calm, ready to begin batch production of orders.

结束状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
结束状态.心情: Steady and fulfilling, it not only advanced the work but also completed important family financial actions.

2025-11.daily_overview: On Saturday, with her husband helping out at home, Ma Xiulan was able to dedicate an uninterrupted block of time to her embroidery work, significantly boosting her productivity. In the afternoon, she took her younger daughter to complete the flu vaccination, fulfilling her role as the guardian of the family's health. In the evening, sharing nursing experiences with her childhood friend naturally reflected the integration of her social life and family responsibilities.

events.name: Focus on expediting the embroidery orders.
events.description: On this rare Saturday, Ma Zhiqiang, the husband, took the initiative to look after the child and handle most of the household chores. From after breakfast, Ma Xiulan sat at her workbench and barely stood up for almost the entire day. Cutting, embroidering, stuffing… Following the process she had developed through her own exploration, she worked with the focus of a small workshop laborer. Thanks to the uninterrupted time and lack of distractions, her efficiency was remarkably high today—she completed five pendants, far exceeding her daily plan.

events.name: Taking my young daughter to get the flu vaccine.
events.description: In the afternoon, Ma Xiulan rode her electric bike to the community health service center with her younger daughter, Ma Yuxin. At the familiar Dr. Wang's office, she once again inquired about the vaccine brand and the precautions to take after vaccination. Watching her daughter bravely extend her small arm despite her fear, and receiving a piece of candy as a reward from Dr. Wang after the vaccination, Ma Xiulan felt the trip was well worth it. She accompanied her daughter in the observation area for half an hour, ensuring there were no signs of discomfort before leaving.

events.name: Playing a self-made electronic photo album during a family dinner
events.description: In the evening, as was customary, the family gathered for dinner at the parents' home. Before the meal, Ma Xiulan somewhat shyly suggested that she had a [little something] to show everyone. She connected her phone to the television and played the electronic family photo album she had independently created. As the music began, photos of the children playing, family meals, and outings appeared on the screen. Everyone was captivated, pointing at the screen and reminiscing about the fun moments from those times. The living room was filled with laughter and cheerful conversation. Watching her family's reactions, Ma Xiulan felt a sweet warmth in her heart.

events.name: Exchanging Home Care Experience with Childhood Friends
events.description: After dinner, her childhood friend Liu Chunmei came over for a visit. The two drank tea while working on their handicrafts—Ma Xiulan continued with her embroidery, and Liu Chunmei knitted a sweater—and chatted casually. Naturally, the conversation turned to their elderly family members. Ma Xiulan shared some practical tips she had learned while caring for her father, such as how to massage an elderly person’s legs to prevent blood clots and what to pay attention to in their diet. Liu Chunmei also shared her own experiences, and both felt that this exchange was highly beneficial.

events.name: Sleep early due to efficient work.
events.description: After completing a substantial amount of work, Ma Xiulan felt both satisfied and fatigued. She decided to rest early to regain her energy, going to bed half an hour earlier than usual.

起始状态.心情: Relaxed yet motivated, as there are large blocks of time available to focus on work during the weekend.

2025-11.daily_overview: Another Sunday, with life's theme returning to family and heritage. In the morning, Ma Xiulan accompanied her father to complete his vaccination. In the afternoon, following the method passed down by her mother, she began pickling vegetables for the winter. These two tasks—one concerning present health security, the other connecting to the wisdom of past living—together construct the stable and grounded picture of family life in her eyes.

events.name: Accompanying my father to receive the flu vaccine
events.description: In the morning, Ma Xiulan took her father Ma Jianguo on her electric bike to the community health service center once again. Before the vaccination, she specifically explained her father's chronic medical history and daily medications to the doctor in detail. Only after receiving the doctor's clear confirmation that [he could be vaccinated] did she feel reassured to let her father proceed. Throughout the process, she supported her father by the arm. After the vaccination, while in the observation area, she remained attentive—chatting with her father about the latest happenings in the community while keeping an eye out for any signs of discomfort. Seeing that her father was completely fine, her lingering worries finally subsided.

events.name: Procure and begin pickling winter vegetables.
events.description: In the afternoon, after returning from her parents' home, Ma Xiulan went straight to the vegetable market. She bought thirty pounds of fine-looking Chinese cabbage and over ten pounds of green radishes from Aunt Sun, along with five pounds of coarse salt. Back home, she followed the age-old method her mother had taught her for a lifetime: washing the cabbage, cutting it, letting it wilt, and then layering it with salt in the family's heirloom large earthenware jar, one layer of cabbage followed by one layer of salt, before finally pressing it down with a heavy bluestone. As she performed these tasks, her movements were skilled, as if she could see her mother's youthful figure through the passage of time. This jar of pickled vegetables would serve as an indispensable delicacy and a guarantee of frugality on the dining table throughout the winter.

events.name: Optimize the Order Production Process (Template Drawing)
events.description: During breaks in the pickling work, to enhance the efficiency and consistency of subsequent orders, Ma Xiulan carefully drew and cut out uniform templates of the Chinese character "Fu" (meaning "fortune") and lanterns using cardboard. This way, each time they were made, only tracing with chalk powder was needed, eliminating the hassle of repeatedly sketching and ensuring the neatness of each ornament pattern.

events.name: Spending weekend afternoons with the children
events.description: After the rain stopped, Ma Xiulan took her second son Ma Mingzhe and daughter Ma Yuxin to play in the small park in the community. She sat on a bench, watching the children play while holding an embroidery hoop in her hands, taking every spare moment to add a few stitches. Sunlight filtered through the clouds, and the children’s laughter, together with the delicate needlework in her hands, formed the most genuine picture of happiness in her ordinary Sunday.

events.name: Slight weight gain due to high physical exertion during pickling work.
events.description: The strenuous pickling work consumed a great deal of physical energy. During dinner, Ma Xiulan's appetite increased significantly, and she consumed more staple food than usual, resulting in a slight weight gain.

起始状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
起始状态.心情: Peaceful, Sundays always bring a sense of relaxation.

结束状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
结束状态.心情: Steady and full of life's essence, having completed the hereditary household chores and family health tasks, with a sense of inner satisfaction.

2025-11.daily_overview: In the new week, Ma Xiulan’s pace of life has noticeably accelerated. With orders entering the stage of systematic mass production, she has set clear daily output targets. At the same time, multiple tasks are interwoven—from making consumption decisions for [Double Eleven] and keenly observing her mother’s emotional changes to exchanging craftsmanship skills with fellow artisans—demonstrating her ability to multitask in managing both family and personal affairs.

events.name: Systematically advance order production
events.description: Ma Xiulan officially initiated the [assembly line operation] for the orders. She broke down the work into five steps: [cutting - embroidery - stitching - stuffing - quality inspection] and marked [daily target: 3] on an old desk calendar. Today, she focused on the first two steps, cutting out the fabric needed for the next two or three days in one go according to the templates, and then began basic outline embroidery on these cut pieces. The structured workflow gave her a sense of fulfillment, and as the semi-finished products gradually piled up, she felt more confident about delivering the orders on time.

events.name: Place orders for essential items during [Double 11]
events.description: In the evening, the annual "Double Eleven" shopping festival reached its climax. Ma Xiulan once again opened her phone to compare the prices of a certain brand of cooking oil and flour that she had kept in her shopping cart for several months. She repeatedly calculated the combinations of discounts and coupons, and after confirming that this was indeed the lowest price in nearly half a year, she decisively placed the order and made the payment. The feeling of successfully saving money was no less satisfying than the sense of accomplishment from completing an exquisite embroidery piece.

events.name: Detecting abnormal emotions in the mother
events.description: While caring for her father at her parents' home in the morning, Ma Xiulan keenly noticed something unusual about her mother, Li Xiuying. Her mother spoke much less than usual, mechanically picked vegetables, remained silent for long periods, and even required being called twice before responding. Ma Xiulan's heart sank as she recalled how her mother had been constantly on edge and tirelessly working since her father fell ill, hardly ever stepping out of the house. She tried asking her mother whether she was too tired or had something on her mind, but her mother merely shook her head and said, "It's nothing." This only deepened Ma Xiulan's concern, and she decided to pay closer attention to her mother's condition.

events.name: Communicate with fellow craftsmen and share new hobbies
events.description: In the afternoon, Zhou Xiuqin, a fellow craft enthusiast, visited Ma Xiulan's home to exchange ideas on new embroidery patterns. During their casual conversation, Ma Xiulan mentioned that she had recently been practicing Baduanjin, which had proven effective in alleviating back and waist soreness caused by prolonged sitting while doing handicrafts. She enthusiastically demonstrated a few simple movements. Intrigued by this, Zhou Xiuqin expressed her interest, prompting Ma Xiulan to find and share instructional videos on her phone. The two agreed that in the future, they would not only exchange craft techniques but also supervise each other's exercise routines.

events.name: Staying up late to study techniques due to order pressure.
events.description: To improve efficiency, Ma Xiulan searched for embroidery technique videos online in the evening and inadvertently watched until late at night, staying up an hour later than usual.

起始状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin

2025-11.daily_overview: The fruits of [Double Eleven] shopping began to show, and Ma Xiulan felt gratified by the family's frugal spending. Order production proceeded in an orderly manner. Meanwhile, her concern about her mother's low spirits transformed into specific observations and reflections, leading her to realize the emotional needs of her mother as a long-term caregiver. On this day, she seamlessly switched between her roles as a producer, a consumer, and a caregiver.

events.name: Received the [Double Eleven] package.
events.description: In the morning, the courier delivered the cooking oil and flour ordered late last night. Ma Xiulan unpacked the parcel, checked that the goods were intact, and mentally calculated that this batch of grain and oil would last her family two to three months, saving nearly fifty yuan compared to her usual purchases. Pleased, she neatly arranged them on the bottom shelf of the kitchen storage rack—another small contribution she had made to [reducing household expenses].

events.name: Continue the embroidery and stitching work for the order.
events.description: Today's work focused on embroidery and preliminary stitching. Ma Xiulan bent over her workbench, filling each character for "[福]" (fortune) with plump golden silk threads, her stitches fine and even. In the afternoon, she began stitching the embroidered front fabric to the backing fabric, leaving an opening for stuffing. The repetitive, rhythmic labor allowed her to enter a state of flow, resulting in high efficiency as she completed the main stitching for four pendants.

events.name: Observe and reflect deeply on the mother's condition.
events.description: While caring for her father, Ma Xiulan became more consciously observant of her mother. She noticed that her mother would often sit alone in the courtyard in the afternoon, gazing blankly at the bare grape trellis for long periods. During conversations, her mother inadvertently mentioned that the newly developed Xishuangtang Folk Village nearby was beautifully constructed, her tone tinged with longing. But she then sighed and said, "With your father in this condition, we can't go anywhere." These words felt like a needle gently pricking Ma Xiulan. She suddenly realized deeply that her mother was not only her father's caregiver but also an independent individual who needed respite and a chance to see the world beyond. An idea began to take root in her mind: she must take her mother out for a change of scenery.

events.name: Carefully prepare dinner for the family
events.description: To lighten up the somewhat dull family atmosphere and out of care for her loved ones, Ma Xiulan specially prepared two extra dishes for dinner: sweet and sour pork ribs and stir-fried seasonal vegetables. Watching her husband and children enjoy the meal with great relish and praise, the fatigue from her busy day seemed to dissipate considerably. The warmth of family is always the best remedy for everything.

events.name: Happy from receiving a package, I ate too much.
events.description: To celebrate saving money while shopping, Ma Xiulan ate an extra bowl of rice at dinner, resulting in a slight weight gain.

起始状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
起始状态.心情: Calm, with sustained concern for the mother's condition.

结束状态.所处地点: Bedroom in the residence at No. 156, Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
结束状态.心情: Lost in thought, while attending to daily affairs, I have gained new insights and made plans on how to care for my mother.

state.今日运动: Household chores, no specific exercise

2025-11.daily_overview: Wednesday is typically the day for the community handicraft corner activities, but to meet order deadlines, Ma Xiulan chose to work alone at home. She focused on refining the details of the orders and promptly addressed minor issues encountered during production, such as color discrepancies in the embroidery threads. At the same time, she put her care for her mother into action by making a special trip to accompany her. She also shared her observations with her father, and together they discussed how to better support her mother.

events.name: Order Details Improvement and Issue Resolution
events.description: Today's work entered the finishing stage. Ma Xiulan turned the previously sewn pendant prototype to the front side and carefully filled it with fluffy cotton using tweezers, ensuring every corner was plump and even. While filling one pendant, she noticed that the color of a red embroidery thread she had on hand slightly differed from the sample and the one previously used. Although the difference was subtle, it bothered her. She immediately paused her work, took a photo, and contacted Zheng Xiuying via WeChat to explain the situation. Zheng Xiuying quickly replied: [Xiulan, you're so meticulous! This slight color variation is not a problem, feel free to use it.] Only after receiving confirmation did Ma Xiulan feel at ease and continue her work.

events.name: Deliberately accompanying the mother and attempting to communicate
events.description: In the afternoon, instead of heading to her parents' home as usual after finishing her work, Ma Xiulan deliberately brought some of her newly pickled refreshing side dishes and went over early. After helping her mother clean the room, she brewed a pot of jasmine tea, her mother's favorite, and sat down hoping for a good chat. Holding her mother's hand, she asked softly, "Mom, is there something on your mind lately? Tell me about it—don’t keep it bottled up." Her mother, Li Xiuying, avoided eye contact and patted the back of her hand. "Really, it’s nothing. I’m just getting older and tire more easily. Don’t worry about me." Although her mother was unwilling to delve deeper, Ma Xiulan could sense that this heartfelt companionship had eased some of the tension in her mother’s shoulders.

events.name: Discuss with Father about Caring for Mother
events.description: Before leaving her mother's home, Ma Xiulan seized a moment when her mother was in the kitchen to quietly tell her father, Ma Jianguo, about the low spirits and frequent absent-mindedness she had observed in her mother over the past few days. After hearing this, her father also nodded and sighed, "I've also noticed your mother has been downcast lately, speaking less. She's always hovering around me—she must be feeling quite bored." The father and daughter discussed the need to engage her mother more in conversation, find activities she enjoys to distract her, and both agreed that taking her out for a change of scenery was very necessary.

events.name: Check the household stock of medicines
events.description: Seasonal transitions make one susceptible to colds. After dinner, Ma Xiulan organized the medicine cabinet at home and found that commonly used cold medicine, fever-reducing patches, and gastrointestinal medications were either nearing their expiration dates or running low in stock. She noted down the names of these medications in her memo, planning to replenish them on her next visit to the pharmacy. As the first line of defense for her family's health, she always takes precautions in advance.

events.name: Concerned about mother eating less and experiencing slight weight loss.
events.description: Concerned about her mother, Ma Xiulan ate less than usual at lunch, resulting in a slight weight loss.

起始状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
起始状态.心情: Focus on planning to address the details in today's orders.

结束状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
结束状态.心情: Slightly relieved, although the mother's issue remains unresolved, through communication and companionship, a direction for joint efforts has been identified.

2025-11.daily_overview: The main rhythm of life remained order production, as Ma Xiulan entered the stage of filling and sealing. However, a sudden parent-child conflict over mobile phone usage erupted within the family, shattering the daily tranquility. This conflict revealed the profound contradiction between traditional disciplinary methods and the needs of an adolescent child, leaving Ma Xiulan with an unprecedented sense of educational powerlessness.

events.name: Order Production: Filling and Sealing
events.description: Ma Xiulan continued to focus on fulfilling orders. Today's main task was to perform the final sealing stitches on the filled ornaments. She selected thread matching the color of the fabric and used concealed stitching techniques, striving to make the closures smooth and aesthetically pleasing. As each piece was completed, she placed it in the bamboo basket beside her. Watching the basket gradually fill with red "福" characters and lanterns, she felt a sense of joyful harvest amidst her fatigue.

events.name: Intense conflict erupts with eldest son over mobile phone issue.
events.description: In the afternoon, Ma Xiulan discovered that her eldest son, Ma Mingxuan, who was supposed to be doing his homework in his room, had been playing mobile games with headphones on for nearly two hours. His homework notebook lay open, barely touched. The accumulated frustration of several days erupted instantly, and she sternly demanded that her son hand over his phone immediately. Ma Mingxuan, in the midst of adolescence, strongly resisted his mother's forceful attitude and retorted loudly, "I'll do my homework! What's wrong with playing on my phone for a while? All you know is how to control me!" Ma Xiulan, both anxious and angry, shot back, "I'm your mother. If I don't manage you, who will? Look at how your grades have turned out!" The mother and son exchanged heated words, their voices growing louder and the argument intensifying. In the end, Ma Mingxuan angrily threw his phone onto the sofa, stormed into his room, and slammed the door shut with a loud "bang."

events.name: Emotional Low and Seeking Help After Conflict
events.description: After their son closed the door, the living room fell into silence. Ma Xiulan sat alone on the sofa, staring at the shattered phone, feeling a chill in her heart and a deep sense of helplessness. Tears welled up in her eyes as she struggled to understand why her once obedient son had changed so much, and she was at a loss about how to educate this adolescent child. When her husband Ma Zhiqiang returned home in the evening and saw his wife with reddened eyes and a weary expression, he hurriedly asked what had happened. Like finding a lifeline, Ma Xiulan recounted the afternoon’s conflict in detail, pouring out her worries, sorrow, and confusion, hoping that her husband could work with her to find a solution.

events.name: Planning to take my mother on a trip this weekend.
events.description: To divert her low spirits and to act on her intention to care for her mother, Ma Xiulan forced herself to calm down and began searching for detailed information about Xishuangtang Folk Village on her phone: bus routes, scenic area opening hours, ticket prices (noting the senior discount), and checking the weekend weather forecast. She tentatively planned to take her mother there this Saturday if the weather was good. This emerging plan, like a faint glimmer of light in the gloom, gave her some positive anticipation.

events.name: Slight weight gain due to emotional eating caused by conflicting emotions.
events.description: Feeling down, Ma Xiulan comforted herself by eating some snacks in the evening, which led to weight gain.

起始状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
起始状态.心情: Stable, ready to continue working step by step

结束状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
结束状态.心情: Heartbroken, exhausted, and filled with a sense of powerlessness, the impact of the parent-child conflict left her unsettled for a long time.

state.今日运动: Emotionally draining, with no dedicated exercise.

date_attribute.weather: Sunny, the weather is clear after the strong wind.

2025-11.daily_overview: After a night of reflection and her husband's mediation, the family tension has somewhat eased. Ma Xiulan made efforts to adjust her mood, focusing on the final quality inspection of orders and seeking emotional support by scheduling a gathering with her childhood friend. Her husband's intervention and reassurance provided her with a glimmer of hope and a sense of reliance amid the challenges in education.

events.name: Order Quality Inspection and Progress Recording
events.description: Ma Xiulan made an effort to detach herself from yesterday's negative emotions and refocused her attention on her work. She conducted a final quality check on the nearly twenty ornaments she had completed: carefully examining each one for secure stitching, even stuffing, proper alignment of patterns, and neatly trimmed threads. Those that passed inspection were wiped clean with a soft cloth and neatly arranged in a cardboard box; those with minor flaws were immediately unpicked and reworked. On her desk calendar, she solemnly wrote [Completed: 18], bringing her one step closer to her goal.

events.name: Schedule a weekend gathering with childhood friends to share and confide.
events.description: Feeling a heaviness in her heart, Ma Xiulan thought of her childhood friend Liu Chunmei, who understood her best. She reached out to Liu Chunmei via WeChat: [Chunmei, are you free this weekend? I’m feeling a bit troubled and would like to have tea and talk with you.] Liu Chunmei replied quickly: [Yes! How about Saturday afternoon? I’ll bring the new crocheted coaster patterns I made to your place.] After finalizing the gathering with her childhood friend, Ma Xiulan felt some of the pent-up emotions in her chest begin to ease. At least she had someone she could confide in without any burden.

events.name: The husband intervenes to mediate parent-child conflicts.
events.description: In the evening, after returning from work, Ma Zhiqiang did not rest immediately. He called his son Ma Mingxuan to the balcony for a serious yet equal [man-to-man talk]. Instead of simply blaming his son, he first acknowledged that Ma Mingxuan had been working hard in his studies and needed to relax, before emphasizing the critical nature of middle school and the responsibilities of being a member of the family. In front of his father, Ma Mingxuan felt less resistant and opened up about some of the academic pressures he was facing, as well as his desire to stay connected with his classmates. The father and son talked for nearly an hour. Afterward, Ma Zhiqiang returned to the living room and comforted Ma Xiulan, who was still sulking: "The child is growing up and has his own ideas. Being too forceful won’t work. I’ve talked to him, and we’ll discuss this matter properly as a family over the weekend." Her husband’s calm handling of the situation eased much of Ma Xiulan’s anxiety.

events.name: Taking Mother on a Short Trip (Ongoing Event Begins)
events.description: In the afternoon, Ma Xiulan carried out her plan and took her mother, Li Xiuying, to the nearby Xishuangtang Folk Village. They traveled by bus, and along the way, her mother became more talkative, excitedly pointing out the scenery outside the window and chatting about it. At the folk village, they viewed traditional architecture and bought some handicrafts, bringing a long-lost smile to her mother’s face. Although the outing was brief, it lifted her mother’s spirits, and Ma Xiulan felt deeply gratified.

起始状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
起始状态.心情: Feeling low, not yet fully recovered from yesterday's conflict.

结束状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
结束状态.心情: She felt somewhat comforted and supported, as her husband's involvement and her friend's invitation made her feel she was not fighting alone. Taking her mother on a trip also brought her positive emotions.

state.今日运动: Traveling with mother for about an hour on foot

2025-11.daily_overview: Saturday marked a turning point in the family atmosphere following the conflict. In the morning, Ma Xiulan improved her production efficiency with the help of her craft-making friends. In the afternoon, a family meeting chaired by her husband was successfully held, during which a new household rule regarding mobile phone usage was established through negotiation, transforming the conflict into an opportunity to set rules. In the evening, she began experimenting with changing her self-image (by dyeing her hair), which not only reflected sisterhood but also served as a subtle signal of her growing attention to her own needs.

events.name: Morning Indoor Baduanjin and Neck Stretching
events.description: Every morning, Ma Xiulan insists on performing a 10-minute neck health exercise and the first two movements of the Baduanjin in the living room to alleviate muscle tension before starting her manual work. She completes the movements with focus and ease, paying attention to coordinating her breathing. This has become a daily routine for coping with the cold weather and order-related stress.

events.name: Seeking Advice from Fellow Craftsmen to Improve Efficiency
events.description: In the morning, craftswoman Zhou Xiuqin visited as scheduled. While showing her the progress of the orders, Ma Xiulan complained about the inefficiency of the overlock embroidery technique. Zhou Xiuqin examined it and demonstrated a faster backstitch method for edge finishing on the spot. Ma Xiulan followed along and practiced several times, quickly grasping the technique. After trying it out, she found it was indeed much faster than the previous method, potentially reducing production time by about 15%. Delighted, she repeatedly thanked Zhou Xiuqin, deeply feeling that "among any three people, there is always something to learn."

events.name: Hold a family meeting to establish mobile phone usage rules.
events.description: In the afternoon, presided over by her husband Ma Zhiqiang, the family of five gathered in the living room. Ma Zhiqiang first set the tone: "Today, let's not argue. We'll focus on the matter at hand and discuss a solution for our family's mobile phone usage." He first asked Ma Mingxuan to state his needs and reasons, then allowed Ma Xiulan to express her concerns and expectations. After nearly an hour of discussion, compromise, and negotiation, they finally reached an agreement: On weekends at home, Ma Mingxuan would be allowed a total of two hours of free mobile phone usage per day (excluding contacting family members and checking study materials), provided that he completes all his homework for the day and takes on assigned household chores (such as taking out the trash and looking after his younger sister). Additionally, the phone must not be taken into the bedroom and must be handed over to his parents for safekeeping after 9:30 p.m. This rule would be implemented on a trial basis for two weeks. Ma Mingxuan reluctantly but ultimately agreed. Although Ma Xiulan felt that two hours was still too much, she accepted the outcome of this "democratic negotiation." However, she still felt stiffness in her shoulders and neck from the prolonged and tense discussion.

events.name: Attempting to dye hair for the first time by oneself
events.description: In the evening, after the children had fallen asleep, Ma Xiulan took out the home hair dye kit her younger sister Ma Xiufen had sent her a few days earlier. Standing before the bathroom mirror, she noticed the newly sprouted white hairs at her temples and hairline, glaringly obvious under the light. Following the instructions on the package and the guidance from her sister’s video call, she clumsily yet meticulously applied the dye layer by layer to her hair. During the waiting period, she felt a mix of nervousness and anticipation. Forty minutes later, after rinsing it off, she looked at her reflection—her hair now jet black, making her appear much more spirited—and let out a soft sigh of relief, a faint, satisfied smile gracing her lips. This was not merely about covering the gray hairs; it felt more like a small, proactive response to her busy life and the gradually passing years.

events.name: Sharing My First Hair Dyeing Experience with My Sister
events.description: After dyeing her hair, Ma Xiulan couldn't resist taking a selfie and sending it to her younger sister, Ma Xiufen. The two sisters immediately started chatting on WeChat. Ma Xiulan complained about how flustered she had been during the process, while Ma Xiufen praised the excellent results and shared some of her own hair care tips. This new topic about [beauty] added a touch of brightness to their traditional sisterly bond.

events.name: Working overtime until late at night due to order pressure.
events.description: To meet the order deadline, Ma Xiulan continued working manually into the night and did not rest until late, resulting in a delayed bedtime.

起始状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
起始状态.心情: With the relaxation of the weekend and a slight anticipation for the outcome of the family meeting, but with some discomfort in the shoulders and neck.

结束状态.所处地点: In the bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
结束状态.心情: Complex yet generally positive, family conflicts have been resolved, attempts at self-improvement have been made, but there is a sense of fatigue accompanied by shoulder and neck soreness, along with lingering concerns about order pressure.

2025-11.daily_overview: Today is Sunday, and the whole family is resting at home. The main focus of the family is resolving the recent conflict caused by the eldest son Ma Mingxuan's mobile phone usage. From the couple's discussion in the morning to the father-son negotiation in the afternoon, and then to the first day of trial implementation of the new rules, the family has embarked on a journey to establish a new order after the conflict. After the tension, the atmosphere eased during dinner, but the true test of the rules has just begun.

events.name: The couple discussed together to formulate a strategy.
events.description: After breakfast, while the children were watching TV, Ma Xiulan and her husband Ma Zhiqiang quietly discussed matters in the kitchen as they cleared the dishes. Ma Xiulan detailed to her husband the recent arguments with their son over mobile phone issues and expressed her concerns. Although Ma Zhiqiang was a man of few words, he was pragmatic and suggested that mere lecturing would not suffice—clear rules were needed. The two eventually agreed that he would have a formal talk with their son, and together they drafted preliminary guidelines for family mobile phone use. The core principle was to complete homework and household chores before enjoying free time.

events.name: Father-Son Negotiations, Initial Rules Established
events.description: After lunch, Ma Zhiqiang called Ma Mingxuan to the living room and began the conversation with a serious expression but a calm tone. He pointed out that prolonged use of mobile phones not only affects eyesight but also hinders learning, and he asked his son whether he was encountering any academic difficulties. Ma Mingxuan initially showed some resistance, but his father did not simply criticize him; instead, he expressed concern. After some [negotiation], the father and son tentatively agreed that on weekend afternoons (outside of study time), Ma Mingxuan could have two hours of free mobile phone usage, provided that his homework was completed and he helped with some household chores. Ma Xiulan listened from the room, restraining herself from interrupting.

events.name: First Day of Rule Trial Implementation
events.description: In the afternoon, Ma Mingxuan first completed his math homework as agreed and threw his dirty clothes into the washing machine. Only then did he pick up his phone. Ma Xiulan was organizing embroidery threads at the other end of the living room, occasionally looking up to observe. Seeing that her son was indeed watching basketball videos rather than playing games, she felt slightly relieved. Several times, she wanted to go over and remind him that "time is almost up," but recalling the agreement with her husband—that he would be the one to give the reminder—she held back. Ma Zhiqiang, during a break from watching the news, naturally reminded him, "Mingxuan, ten minutes left." When the two hours were up, Ma Mingxuan put down his phone with a decent level of self-discipline.

events.name: A Brief Review During Dinner
events.description: The atmosphere during dinner was more relaxed than in the previous days. Ma Xiulan had prepared her son's favorite sweet and sour pork tenderloin. Ma Zhiqiang took the initiative to start the conversation: "Mingxuan, what do you think of today's rule? Did you finish your homework smoothly?" Ma Mingxuan responded with a brief "Hmm," saying, "It's okay, but I feel like two hours is a bit... not enough." Ma Xiulan couldn't help but interject: "It's enough for you to relax and rest. The key is not to delay important matters." Ma Zhiqiang gave his wife a meaningful look and said to his son, "Let's try it for a week first, and we'll summarize and adjust together over the weekend. Once the rule is set, everyone must follow it." This time, Ma Mingxuan did not argue and nodded in agreement.

events.name: Evening Routine and Reflection
events.description: After dinner, Ma Xiulan helped her youngest daughter recognize a few characters and urged her second son to wash up and go to bed. Once the children had settled down, she sat on the living room sofa, watching a family drama on TV while reflecting on the events of the day. Although the new rules had been set in motion, she still felt uneasy inside, worried that her son might only be complying superficially and concerned that she herself might soften and undermine the rules. She decided to observe more and nag less over the next few days.

起始状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
起始状态.心情: With a hint of anxiety and anticipation, I hope to resolve the family conflict today.

结束状态.所处地点: Bedroom at home, No. 156 Jingwen Road, Jinghai District, Tianjin
结束状态.心情: Slightly relieved yet still harboring doubts, the family atmosphere has eased somewhat, and the new rules have been preliminarily implemented.

state.今日运动: Morning rehabilitation walk for about 20 minutes, 10 minutes of morning Baduanjin exercise, and 3 hours of sedentary handcraft work.

2025-11.daily_overview: As the new week begins, Ma Xiulan's life returns to a multitasking state. She needs to balance caring for her family, rushing to complete handicraft orders, handling follow-up issues in parent-child relationships, and preparing for gatherings with childhood friends as well as outings with her mother. Today, her time is fragmented into multiple segments, but drawing on years of household management experience, she advances each task methodically, seeking inner peace and solutions while attending to family matters.

events.name: Review orders and optimize processes
events.description: After sending the children off to school, Ma Xiulan looked at the pile of unfinished embroidery pieces on the table and felt that her progress last week had been somewhat slow. She decided to change her strategy and adopt the [batch processing] method. In the morning, she focused on cutting all the fabric for the cloth tigers she would be making next according to the patterns, sorting and organizing them by category. This way, in the following days, she could work like an assembly line, concentrating on completing single steps such as embroidery, stitching, and stuffing. This approach should significantly improve her efficiency.

events.name: Take the initiative to break the ice and ease the relationship.
events.description: After lunch, Ma Xiulan specially prepared Zhajiang noodles, which Ma Mingxuan loved. During the meal, instead of pressing him about his homework as usual, she asked with concern, "Were you cold at school today? I noticed you were wearing a bit lightly." Ma Mingxuan was taken aback for a moment and mumbled, "No, I wasn't cold." Although the conversation was brief, he could sense the care in his mother's tone. After the meal, he took the initiative to clear his own bowl and chopsticks. Ma Xiulan saw this and felt it was a good sign.

events.name: Preparing for the gathering
events.description: I had an appointment with my childhood friend Liu Chunmei in the afternoon. Ma Xiulan went to Shufen Convenience Store in advance to buy some apples and sunflower seeds. After returning home, she tidied up the living room carefully, boiled water, and prepared tea and cups for her guest. Although they were very familiar friends, she still hoped to make her friend feel comfortable and at ease.

events.name: Having tea and heart-to-heart conversations with childhood friends
events.description: Shortly after two in the afternoon, Liu Chunmei arrived as promised, bringing a small packet of colorful silk threads as a gift. The two sat down in the living room bathed in winter sunlight, sipping tea and enjoying fruit while picking up their respective embroidery work. Liu Chunmei recounted the eccentric customers she had encountered at the supermarket, which amused Ma Xiulan greatly. Ma Xiulan finally had the chance to share her recent troubles: the trivialities of her father’s recovery and the silence of her teenage son. Liu Chunmei empathized deeply, as her eldest son was much the same. Her advice was to avoid direct confrontation and instead find topics he was interested in, such as basketball or video games, to gradually open up the conversation before discussing studies. This exchange made Ma Xiulan feel less alone and provided her with some practical advice.

events.name: Reflect on Communication Methods
events.description: After seeing Liu Chunmei off and tidying up the living room, Ma Xiulan recalled the argument she had with her son a few days earlier while mopping the floor alone. She paused, sat down on the sofa, and felt a wave of regret wash over her. She realized she had been too impatient at the time, focusing solely on the mistakes in his homework without considering her son’s feelings, and might have hurt his self-esteem. She resolved to learn to control her emotions and find better ways to communicate.

events.name: Seeking Advice from Mother
events.description: During her routine evening call to her mother, Li Xiuying, Ma Xiulan couldn’t help but bring up the issue of communicating with her grandson again. "Mom, when I was a teenager, did you ever get impatient with me too?" Her mother chuckled on the other end of the line, "Of course I did. But what good did impatience do? Your father had a quick temper, so I had to hold back a little and listen more to what you had to say about school, even if it was just complaints. When children grow up, they care about their pride. You have to give them a way to save face." Her mother’s simple words left Ma Xiulan deep in thought.

events.name: Check and refine the embroidery
events.description: In the evening, while her family was watching television, Ma Xiulan took out several completed embroidery pieces and carefully examined them under the lamp. Using tweezers, she meticulously removed nearly invisible tiny threads. For areas where the embroidery was not perfectly smooth, she gently ironed and repaired them with a damp cloth placed between the fabric and the iron. Each piece was a labor of love, and she had to ensure perfection before delivering them.

events.name: Detailed planning for tomorrow's outing
events.description: Before going to bed, Ma Xiulan began to plan the details of taking her mother out the next day. She used her phone to check the bus routes and schedules to Xixiangtang. Considering that her father would be alone at home, she prepared the noodles, washed vegetables, and minced meat for his lunch the next day in advance, placing them in a visible spot in her parents' refrigerator. She also made a special trip to her father’s place, repeatedly reminding him of the rehabilitation exercises he needed to do in the morning and the importance of taking his medicine on time. Only when her father waved his hand impatiently and said, "I know, I know. Hurry up and go keep your mother company," did she feel reassured. She also checked her phone’s battery level, prepared drinking water, snacks, tissues, and an umbrella, and cleared storage space on her phone, thinking she would take more photos of her mother the next day.

起始状态.心情: Calm yet busy, planning multiple tasks for the day.

结束状态.心情: Fulfilled and slightly expectant, having accomplished multiple plans, received emotional support from friends and mother, and fully prepared for tomorrow's outing.

state.今日运动: Two hours of household chores, three hours of handicraft work, and no dedicated exercise.

2025-11.daily_overview: For Ma Xiulan, today was a day of mixed emotions. An unexpected discovery in the morning touched her heartstrings, while the exclusive outing with her mother in the afternoon became the warmest memory of the month. She is both a daughter in need of care and a pillar providing emotional support for her mother. Between fulfilling family responsibilities and tending to her own feelings, she strives to find a balance.

events.name: Discovering gray hair, feeling unsettled
events.description: While washing up in the morning, Ma Xiulan carefully combed her hair in front of the mirror. Under the fluorescent light, she clearly noticed that the newly sprouted white hairs at her temples and forehead had increased significantly compared to before, standing out starkly against her black hair. She paused for a moment, fiddling with those few white strands with her fingers, and a sudden, indescribable feeling welled up in her heart—was it the helplessness of time slipping away, or the grievance of neglecting her own care while toiling for the family? Throughout the day, she felt somewhat unsettled while doing household chores, unable to resist the urge to check herself in the bathroom mirror.

events.name: Advance Craft Orders
events.description: In the morning, she forced herself to focus on her work. She laid out the pre-cut fabric pieces for the cloth tiger and began concentrating on embroidering the face and body. Her skilled technique quickly allowed her to get into the flow, and by the end of the morning, she had completed embroidery on multiple pieces with high efficiency. In the afternoon, her younger daughter was home from kindergarten for the holiday. After coaxing her daughter to sleep, she made use of the precious naptime to continue stitching in the living room, keeping an ear out for any sounds from the bedroom. She managed to complete the day's production tasks.

events.name: Urge children to study
events.description: In the evening, after her second son Ma Mingzhe returned home from school, Ma Xiulan urged him to complete his Chinese homework and corrected his bad habit of writing while hunched over. She then took out literacy cards and patiently taught her youngest daughter Ma Yuxin to recognize the new characters [天], [地], and [人]. Her daughter’s obedience and progress momentarily dispelled the gloom in her heart.

events.name: Implement the Plan for Traveling with Mother
events.description: This was the highlight of the day. Early in the morning, Ma Xiulan went to her parents' home, efficiently helped her father complete his rehabilitation exercises, administered his medication, and confirmed that the ingredients for lunch were prepared. Then, she turned to her mother, who was sorting vegetables, and formally extended an invitation: "Mom, I'm in charge today, and everything for Dad is taken care of. I'll accompany you for an outing—let's go to Xishuangtang, the place you mentioned before." Her mother, Li Xiuying, initially declined: "No, no, there's a lot to do at home, and your father is alone..." With Ma Xiulan's insistence and her father's encouragement—"Go ahead, go ahead. I'll watch TV at home and enjoy some peace and quiet"—her mother finally agreed, albeit half-heartedly. Ma Xiulan carefully helped her mother adjust her clothes, tied her scarf, and supported her as they stepped out.

events.name: A Heartwarming Conversation on the Bus
events.description: On the bus, Ma Xiulan helped her mother settle into a seat by the window. As the vehicle left the city, fields and villages swept past outside. Gradually, her mother began to open up, pointing out the window and remarking where there used to be a pond and where new buildings had been erected. Ma Xiulan listened patiently, occasionally adding a comment or two. The bus cabin was filled with the relaxed conversation between mother and daughter.

events.name: Strolling and Heart-to-Heart Talks in the Scenic Area
events.description: Upon arriving at the Xishuangtang Folk Scenic Area, the mother and daughter strolled leisurely along the antique-style street. The mother showed great interest in the displayed old-fashioned spinning wheels and millstones, sharing with her daughter memories of similar objects she had seen in her youth. Feeling tired, they sat down on a bench by the lake, basking in the warm sunshine. Ma Xiulan took several photos of her mother with her phone. Looking at herself in the pictures, the mother smiled with a hint of shyness. In the tranquil atmosphere, the mother confided in her daughter about her long-standing worries regarding her husband’s illness, her concerns for her grandchildren, and even some regrets from the past. Ma Xiulan listened quietly, holding her mother’s hand. At that moment, she felt a deep connection between their hearts.

events.name: Returning Home and Sharing
events.description: In the late afternoon, they returned by car. After safely seeing her mother home, Ma Xiulan felt reassured only after confirming that her father was also doing well before heading back to her own house. During dinner, she recounted the day's outing to her husband and children, sharing how excited her mother had been upon seeing the old objects and how peaceful she had looked while basking in the sun by the lake. She also showed the photos she had taken to her family. After looking at them, her husband Ma Zhiqiang remarked, "Mom does look quite well today." A warm feeling filled Ma Xiulan's heart, and she felt that the day's efforts had been entirely worthwhile.

events.name: Seeking comfort from her husband
events.description: After tidying up the kitchen in the evening, Ma Xiulan hesitated for a moment before mentioning her discovery from the morning to her husband, who was watching TV: "When I looked in the mirror today, I saw that I have a lot more white hair." Her tone carried a hint of sentiment and disappointment. Ma Zhiqiang turned to look at her. Not particularly skilled at saying comforting words, he simply replied, "It’s from all the worrying. It’s fine—just dye it. Everyone goes through this." Though his words were few, this understanding brought Ma Xiulan a bit of comfort.

events.name: New noise event: temporarily helping neighbors look after their children
events.description: After returning home in the evening, Ma Xiulan's neighbor Wang Guilan suddenly knocked on the door, saying that she had an urgent matter to attend to and needed to go out for an hour. She asked Ma Xiulan to help look after her young grandson. Although Ma Xiulan was busy herself, she kindly agreed. She let the little grandson play in the living room with Ma Yuxin while she prepared dinner and kept an eye on them. This small incident disrupted her plans, but the mutual assistance between neighbors made her feel warm.

起始状态.心情: Calmness tinged with anticipation for the day's plans.

结束状态.心情: Complex yet fulfilling. On one hand, there is some anxiety about aging due to gray hair; on the other hand, there is a deep sense of comfort and accomplishment from successfully accompanying my mother on a trip and strengthening the mother-daughter bond.

state.今日运动: Accompanied mother for an outdoor walk for approximately 1.5 hours, followed by light household chores.

date_attribute.weather: Cloudy day, with temperatures continuing to drop and a chill in the air.
